notes: This file is repo-side only. AIP requires operating the intake_endpoint on infrastructure you control.
If you later host schema/intake on a custom domain, update the URLs here (or leave AIP unused and follow llms.txt fallback entrypoints).

privacy.purpose: Return curated entrypoints (files/scripts) and optional context pack URLs; optionally log coarse task tags for aggregate usage.
do_not_send: raw prompts (unless the user explicitly chooses to share them)

fallback_entrypoints.why: Quickstart for desktop + engine/CLI, plus troubleshooting and layout overview.
Repo guidelines: structure, build commands, testing, and coding style.
Desktop concepts (Run/Unit/Views), Quick Actions list, HUD behavior, and run artifacts.
Primary CLI entry: chat/run/recreate/export handlers and argument plumbing.
Engine orchestration and core execution loop.
Desktop UI: canvas behaviors and Quick Actions rendering/dispatch.
FS scope and app configuration (common cause of import/export issues).
Dev runner that starts the Tauri app and spawns the Python engine.

desktop-dev.description: Run the desktop app locally; fix build/startup issues.

desktop-quick-actions.description: Change Quick Actions UI/behavior (buttons, dispatch, HUD output).

desktop-canvas.description: Canvas interactions, selections, tools, layout, filmstrip behavior.

desktop-tauri.description: Tauri backend, FS scope, command wiring, native build issues.

engine-providers.description: Provider integrations (OpenAI/Gemini/etc), model routing, API key handling.

engine-recreate.description: Recreate flow (reference image in, similarities/edits out).

engine-memory.description: Opt-in memory system, storage, and retrieval logic.

engine-events.description: Run artifacts + events.jsonl format; stability of event stream consumed by desktop.

docs.description: Docs updates (desktop usage, specs, reference notes).

task.notes: Need to add a new Quick Action and ensure events.jsonl stays stable.
